title: 50 percent of departing Boston Logan Airport flights canceled Tuesday
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Over 50% of flights departing Boston Logan were canceled Tuesday due to a powerful nor’easter affecting New England.
Amtrak service between Boston's South Station and New York was suspended Monday, with potential limited service Tuesday.
MassPort advises passengers to check with airlines as flight resumptions depend on weather conditions and aircraft availability.

title: To trade or not to trade? Bruins must make their call with Viktor Arvidsson.
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Viktor Arvidsson has provided key offensive output for the Boston Bruins, tallying 14 goals and 28 points over 45 games.
The Bruins need to decide whether to retain or trade Arvidsson by the March 6 NHL trade deadline.
Trading Arvidsson could yield a valuable draft pick but may hinder Boston's playoff prospects for the 2025-26 season.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Tuesday, Feb. 24.
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massive snowstorm in Massachusetts leads to more than 30 inches of snow in parts of the state.
A large number of schools in Massachusetts, including Boston, Worcester, and Cambridge, are closed on Feb. 24.
Some school districts like Athol-Royalston and Littleton are on delayed schedules due to the snowstorm.

title: AJ Brown recalls ‘critical’ Mike Vrabel moments that changed hatred to respect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: AJ Brown initially disliked coach Mike Vrabel, writing 'I hate Vrabel' in his notebook during team meetings.
Brown's respect for Vrabel grew after learning crucial lessons during his rookie season with the Tennessee Titans.
Brown, under contract with the Eagles, is speculated as a trade candidate for the Patriots needing receiver improvements.

title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: US women's hockey team declined President Trump's State of the Union invite citing academic and professional commitments.
The U.S. men's hockey team, also victorious at the Winter Olympics, was invited to both the State of the Union and a White House event.
President Trump joked about the women's team's invitation while speaking with the men's team in a celebration call.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots release Antonio Gibson, saving over $3 million in cap space; he had no guaranteed money for 2026.
Gibson, 27, played 22 games for New England, tallying 644 rushing yards, 212 receiving yards, and three touchdowns.
He was a key kick returner, averaging 28.5 yards, with a notable touchdown against Miami in September 2025.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, starting Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions require visibility under 1/4 mile, winds of 35 mph, and can occur without active snowfall.
The National Weather Service warns of whiteout conditions, power outages, and travel hazards due to strong winds and snow.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen documented intense blizzard conditions in downtown Boston, with powerful gusts and near-whiteout visibility.
Snowfall in Pawtucket, R.I., reached 14 inches on Monday, with severe conditions across Massachusetts predicted by forecasters.
The National Weather Service warned of 18-24 inch snow totals and damaging winds causing whiteout conditions in the region.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton expressed interest in using his RKO move on Tom Brady after Brady called WWE 'cute' on Logan Paul's podcast.
Brady and Paul are set to compete in the upcoming Fanatics Flag Football Classic alongside NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski.
Orton aims to win his 10th elimination chamber match on Saturday, potentially facing WWE champion Drew McIntyre at Wrestlemania 42.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet recorded the highest wind gust at 83 mph on Monday morning, classifying as a Category 1 hurricane.
Wind gusts hit 70+ mph in various Cape Cod locations including Chatham, West Falmouth, and Hyannis.
Strong winds across Massachusetts reached blizzard conditions, with speeds of at least 35 mph sustained for three hours.
